means: 再注满，重新装满( refill的现在分词 )

sentence.Network_en: Refilling his cup, she slopped some tea into the saucer.
sentence.Network_cn: 给他续茶的时候，她不小心溅了一些在茶碟上。

sentence.Network_en: He knocked his pipe out before refilling it.
sentence.Network_cn: 在装烟丝之前,他磕出了烟斗里的烟灰.

sentence.Network_en: It is possible, though not usual, to renovate an exhausted counter by refilling it.
sentence.Network_cn: 通过重新充气,可以使一个不能用的计数器复原, 但通常不这样做.

entry.def: If you refill something, you fill it again after it has been emptied.

example.tran: 我再次斟满了我们的酒杯。

entry.def: A refill of a particular product, such as soap powder, is a quantity of that product sold in a cheaper container than the one it is usually sold in. You use a refill to fill the more permanent container when it is empty.

example.ex: Refill packs are cheaper and lighter.

means.word_mean: 1. filling again by supplying what has been used up
